item.title: Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun and Aiko’s Choice coming to Switch 2 on March 18
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Bundle containing both games priced at $53.99.

Publisher Daedalic Entertainment and developer Mimimi Games will release tactical stealth game Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun and standalone expansion Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun – Aiko’s Choice for Switch 2 on March 18, the companies announced. Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun will be priced at $39.99 / €39.99, while Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun – Aiko’s Choice will cost $19.99 / €19.99. An “Ultimate Edition” bundle containing both games will be available for $53.99 / €53.99.

Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun first launched for PC on December 6, 2016, followed by PlayStation 4 and Xbox One on July 28, 2017, and PlayStation 5 on October 15, 2025. The PC version is available via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG.

Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun – Aiko’s Choice first launched for PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG on December 6, 2021, followed by PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on December 6, 2024.

Here is an overview of each game, via Daedalic Entertainment:

Revealed during today’s Nintendo Direct, Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun comes to Nintendo Switch 2 on March 18, 2026, bringing the full original game and the standalone expansion Aiko’s Choice.

Fully optimized for Nintendo Switch 2 and featuring native mouse support, the modern stealth tactics hit from legendary German indie developer Mimimi Games returns as its definitive console edition—a sharp upgrade of the Edo-period stealth strategy benchmark inspired by genre pioneers like Commandos.

Stealth Strategy reborn on Nintendo Switch 2

Developed by Mimimi Games and published by Daedalic Entertainment, Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun is widely regarded as one of the most influential stealth strategy games of its generation.

Its reputation is backed by a Metacritic score of 85 and a strong awards track record since its original release on PC, including top honors at the German Game Developer Awards (Best German Game, Best PC/Console Game, Best Game Design), plus multiple Editor’s Choice awards internationally.

In addition, Shadow Tactics has built a long-lasting reputation with players worldwide: on Steam, it holds an “Overwhelmingly Positive” rating of 96 percent, based on over 30,000 user reviews, underlining its status as a modern stealth strategy classic with exceptional long-term appeal.

On Nintendo Switch 2, it reaches a new peak:

  • Best-in-class console version, featuring Switch 2 mouse-mode support for unmatched precision.
  • The Ultimate Edition includes the full 25-plus hours main campaign and the Aiko’s Choice add-on.
  • Optimized for Switch 2, with improved loading times and polished performance.
  • High-definition (1080p) gameplay at 30 frames per second in handheld mode, and 4K output at 30 frames per second in TV mode.

Experience the Game That Brought Commandos-Style Stealth Strategy Back to Modern Audiences

Set against the backdrop of Japan’s Edo period, Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun is a stealth strategy game that perfected the classic “Commandos-style” formula and brought it back to modern audiences.

You command a small team of deadly specialists, each with a distinct toolkit. From the agile ninja Hayato to the sniper Takuma, the trap-setting street kid Yuki, the samurai Mugen, and the master-of-disguise Aiko, each character brings unique skills that you must combine with wit and careful planning to complete each mission.

Beyond their abilities, every member of the team has their own background and personal stakes. Over the course of the campaign the group’s relationships evolve, turning tense alliances into trust, and delivering a strong, character-driven story that’s as memorable as the gameplay.

Every mission is a stunning, hand-crafted sandbox of patrol routes, sightlines, and timing: sneak through castles, monasteries, and forest camps, distract guards, set traps, poison targets, or avoid confrontation entirely.

But success isn’t about reflexes: It’s about planning, observation, and executing the perfect multi-character strategy play in the shadows.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem – Nintendo Direct: February 5, 2026 footage
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Latest look at the Switch 2 version.

Capcom debuted new footage of Resident Evil Requiem during today’s Nintendo Direct: Partner Showcase.

Here are the latest details:

Today’s Nintendo Direct featured all-new gameplay footage of the Nintendo Switch 2 version of Resident Evil Requiem, the ninth mainline entry in the iconic survival horror Resident Evil series, which will launch on Nintendo Switch 2, as well as PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Steam, Epic Game Store, and GeForce NOW on February 27, 2026. Experience exhilarating, death-defying action with legendary agent Leon S. Kennedy and spine-tingling survival horror with FBI analyst Grace Ashcroft in a whole new way as you freely switch between first and third-person perspectives at any time. Enjoy a brand new survival horror experience that takes you on a whirlwind journey between calmness and pure intensity.

And launching this summer are the first-ever Resident Evil amiibo for both Grace Ashcroft and the legendary Leon S. Kennedy. Pre-orders for the Deluxe and Standard editions of Resident Evil Requiem are available now, with the Deluxe edition featuring the same base game as the Standard edition, plus an exclusive pack of five costumes, four weapon skins, two screen filters, two charms, and more!

Resident Evil Requiem is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam on February 27.

item.title: PRAGMATA Sketchbook demo now available for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Previously released for PC.

The “Sketchbook” demo for hacking action adventure game PRAGMATA is now available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2, Cpacom announced. It was previously only available for PC.

Here is an overview of the demo, via Capcom:

The PRAGMATA “Sketchbook” demo launches today on consoles. This free public demo transports players to a cold lunar research station in the near future. In this science-fiction action adventure game, spacefarer Hugh and android Diana join forces to find a way back to Earth after the station’s AI classifies them as threats and dispatches enemy Bots to “neutralize” them.

In the demo, players can experience the highly anticipated title’s unique combat and exploration at home for the first time on consoles. Beyond getting a feel for the game’s exhilarating fusion of hacking and shooting, players are encouraged to replay the Sketchbook demo. This taste of the game has been crafted with fun surprises in store, including hidden features you might only find after repeat playthroughs, so prepare to explore and put their action skills to the test.

PRAGMATA is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam on April 24.

item.title: Valheim coming to Switch 2 in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Due out alongside previously announced PlayStation 5 release.

Coffee Stain Publishing and developer Iron Gate Studio will release Viking survival game Valheim for Switch 2 alongside its previously announced PlayStation 5 release in 2026, the companies announced.

Valheim first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on February 2, 2021, followed by Xbox Series and Xbox One on March 14, 2023.

Here are the latest details, via Coffee Stain Publishing:

Announced during the Nintendo Direct: Partner Showcase earlier today, Valheim‘s teeth-clenching survival action will soon be coming to Nintendo Switch 2 devices, supporting full cross play between platforms, touch screen support for menus, advanced vibrations via the HD Rumble 2 and gyroscope aiming.

Valheim is a survival and exploration game for 1-10 players, set in a procedurally-generated purgatory inspired by Viking culture. Developed by Sweden-based indie studio Iron Gate and published by Coffee Stain Publishing, the team behind other hit titles such as Satisfactory and Deep Rock Galactic, the game challenges players to battle, build and carve out their legacy in the tenth realm. Since its meteoric Early Access debut in 2021, Valheim has earned widespread acclaim, boasting a 94% “Very Positive” rating on Steam with more than 524,000 positive reviews and over 12 million copies sold.

Since its Early Access release, Valheim has seen three major and multiple minor content updates expanding the tenth realm with new biomes, weapons, armor, building items and more. On release, the game will offer eight fully fleshed out biomes including the mystical planes of Mistlands, the harsh lavascapes of Ashlands and the enigmatic Deep North.
